MCQ: What is the cell theory's third tenet that was widely accepted by the 1860s?
Choices: a: The basic unit of organisms is the tissue. | b: Individual cells have some characteristics of life. | c: All cells come from the division of other cells. | d: Cells are important for the function of organs.

MCQ: Who is considered the father of taxonomy for his work in the 1735 and 1750s?
Choices: a: Carl Linnaeus | b: Georges-Louis Leclerc, Comte de Buffon | c: Jean-Baptiste Lamarck | d: Charles Darwin

MCQ: Which scientist's work laid the foundation for modern genetics in 1865?
Choices: a: Gregor Mendel | b: Alfred Hershey | c: Martha Chase | d: James Watson
